title: (x) Posh logo sans w/ curls - VGC Agraphicus (Acropolis) {Mike F}
content:
A client gave me a jpeg file with their logo, not so good for printing a large window graphic. Can anyone help me figure out what this font is?

Thanks!

- J

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20121129100316/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_30.gif) | 7.1 KB |
author: Jibran Kutik

comments.content: It reminds me of some of the swishier fonts by Nick Curtis, but none of them match up.

Sort of the idea: [http://www.canadatype.com/showfont.php?id=59](http://web.archive.org/web/20121129100316/http:/www.canadatype.com/showfont.php?id=59)

Some art nouveau-ish faces get close.

That was, predigitally, VGC Agraphicus, but it's been manually condensed. Digitally, Fontbank offered it (years ago) as [Acropolis](http://web.archive.org/web/20121129100316/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/acropolis.htm). I don't know if the folks I linked you to (a Xara offshoot) really have the rights to the old Fontbank (a defunct company) fonts as they claim, but at two dollars, does it really matter much?

Wow!

Thanks! This'll make vectorizing a lot easier!

- J

According to Martin Kotulla, SoftMaker is creating their version of "Agraphicus" and the typeface itself is being cloned as A750 Deco, again in the same design as FontBank's Acropolis & Southern Software's Corruga Display SSi/SSK, except that more symbols/punctuation and international characters were added, joining numbers and some symbols/punctuation. Appearing on "MegaFont XXL 3.0" and "infiniType 4" premium-quality typeface collections - both being released in May 27, 2014.

When you are designing your brochure for print, one of the primary elements that you determination need to make a decision is the volume and fold of your brochure. You should forever design your brochure with the size and nature in brain, instead of annoying to make bigger or shrink an obtainable design to fit explain you desire.

[http://www.emanprinting.com/folder-printing/Plastic-Folders.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20121129100316/http:/www.emanprinting.com/folder-printing/Plastic-Folders.php "http://www.emanprinting.com/folder-printing/Plastic-Folders.php")
